Shutu.Action: Sits quietly, looking worried and scared during the car ride.
Engages with a Rubik’s cube, but sneakily observes Mimi’s reflection in the rear view mirror.
Sits nervously at the edge of his seat, looks worried and scared during the car journey.
Manipulates a Rubik’s cube, indicating some mental engagement or skill.
Surreptitiously watches Mimi through the rear view mirror, showing distraction rather than focus.
Smiles at Nandu after he notices the girls huddled up in the cold, then goes back to his Rubik’s cube.
Leans out of the car window to get a better look at the town signboard.
Greets Mrs Curney shyly and somewhat hesitantly; responds with uncertainty about last visit date.
Engages in the interaction without obvious social confidence but follows the flow of conversation.
Listens attentively when instructed by Nandu and promptly follows the instruction to lock the boundary wall by abruptly turning around and going outside.
Watches the group exchange shyly, gives a tight smile when teased, does not join the boisterous banter.
Reacts somewhat irked and shy rather than engaging openly with friends' teasing.
Watches others' exchange shyly, gives a tight smile when teased but does not respond assertively.
Does not initiate conversation or engage confidently with others in the scene.
Congratulates Brian sincerely as he sits down next to him at the dining table.
Watches the couple Vikram and Mimi kiss from the shadows with an intense look, then steps back quietly.
Sits attentively on the floor with wide-eyed concentration while listening to Vikram's anecdote.
Questions the plausibility of spirits returning by asking 'Why would they come back at all?'
Feels uneasy and reluctant to participate in the séance, explains his concern about causing pain to the dead, smiles and sits back down reluctantly when encouraged.
Avoids being the medium and tries to leave early claiming tiredness.
Avoids participating in the group activity by expressing discomfort and excuses, shows nervousness and reluctance under peer pressure.
Eventually sits back down reluctantly despite earlier refusal, indicating some social adaptability.
Leaves the room abruptly in a strangled voice saying 'I'm going to bed.' and hides under the blanket, showing vulnerability rather than engaging.
Lights Mimi's cigarette eagerly when she looks for a lighter.
Smiles sheepishly when asked to shave.
Eagerly removes matchbox from his pocket and lights Mimi’s cigarette.
Smiles sheepishly when asked to shave, showing hesitation or reluctance to perform a basic task.
Smiles and shakes his head when Bonnie calls out, shows subtle friendliness.
Does not respond to Tani’s call and remains absorbed with puppies, ignoring a child’s request.
Obediently goes to get Bonnie's shawl when asked.
Volunteers to help Tani with Bonnie, showing willingness to assist and be involved.
Smiles looking at Tani after she considers his approval, demonstrating positive social engagement and confidence.
Is seen reading a classic novel (20,000 Leagues Under the Sea) attentively, indicating intellectual engagement and a habit of self-education.
Explains he finished his M.Sc. and plans to apply for a Ph.D. and scholarship, showing academic achievement and career planning.
Shrugs and smiles when asked what if he does not get the scholarship, suggesting possible uncertainty or lack of a clear backup plan.
Laughs sheepishly at Mimi's teasing about a girlfriend
Obediently gets a second helping of dessert for Aunty
Reacts with fear when Vikram startles him by rolling a glass on the floor
Bends down to pick up the broken dessert bowl after almost dropping it
Suggests to Tani to go home and gets into the car peacefully
Smiles and shrugs when asked about scholarship failure, showing a calm, accepting attitude.
Laughs sheepishly when teased about a girlfriend, indicating social awkwardness or discomfort.
Responds promptly to Aunty’s request to get a second helping of dessert, demonstrating basic responsibility.
Reacting fearfully to Vikram’s glass prank, almost dropping the dessert bowl, showing a lack of composure and ease in unexpected situations.
Bends down to pick up the broken bowl after the prank, indicating a sense of responsibility to clean up mistakes.
Asks Tani to go home and relaxes by lying down in the passenger seat, showing a low-energy, passive demeanor.
Smiles and declines to drive at first, showing modesty and reluctance.
Attempts to drive despite being inexperienced; tries multiple gear positions and continues trying after stalling.
Sweats nervously and follows instructions even under pressure, showing trust and willingness to learn.
Brushes off driving suggestion with a smile and admits lack of practice
Fiddles with gear positions before selecting reverse, showing lack of familiarity
Starts the car and reverses but engine goes off and car moves jerkily
Sweats nervously and fumbles with gear, struggling to follow basic driving instructions
Looks blankly when instructed about hand position on steering wheel, showing confusion
Plays a game of chess attentively with Nandu, showing focus and engagement.
Is assigned the responsibility of looking after the puppy as a joke among others, possibly indicating perceived inability or unreliability.
Looks at the bike curiously and smiles shyly, reaches out to touch the handlebars
Obeys Nandu’s instruction to lock the door without protest
Watches the gate attentively as others move around
Obeys Nandu's request to lock the door promptly without hesitation.
Looks at the bike curiously and tries to touch the handlebars but is stopped by Vikram.
Passively watches Mimi go into the house and stays by the gate without further engagement or initiative.
Claims he was winning the chess game confidently and smiles at Mimi
Looks at Mimi with an unsure smile after her comment
Clears up the chess pieces near a dying fire calmly
Winks at Tani, showing a friendly and playful interaction.
Walks towards Brian after not being chosen by Vikram; Brian puts an arm around him.
Plays really well and is cheered on by others, particularly by Mimi and Bonnie.
Becomes a little cocky and provokes Vikram with his tactics during the game.
Hits Vikram’s face in an attempt to get away during a scuffle, escalating the situation.
Tries to kick Vikram in a fight after being grabbed, causes bleeding.
Sits quietly, panting and distant while Aunty tends to his wounds.
Responds distractedly and somewhat questioningly to Aunty's suggestion to call his mother.
Appears scared and disoriented, stuck in a bathroom corner.
Allows Nandu to comfort and lead him back to bed without resistance.
Pretends to bury the burnt ant and joins Tani in doing a sign of the cross to humour her
Responds vaguely when Tani asks what to do about the dead ant
Collects the burnt ant and debris and pretends to bury it, humorously mimics Tani's religious gesture to put her at ease.
Responds hesitantly and with uncertainty when asked about the ant's death ('I guess').
Sits alone on the sofa, trying to look busy with a magazine while others are dancing and enjoying themselves.
Allows Mimi to pull him up to dance with her despite seeming reluctant initially.
Sits alone on the sofa, trying to look busy with a magazine instead of joining others actively.
Allows Mimi to pull him up to dance, showing some willingness to engage socially despite initial reluctance.
Explains cultural practice of wearing jewelry with some knowledge and confidence.
Dismisses a wound as minor without taking proper care or applying recommended treatment.
Comforts Mimi by allowing her to collapse on his shoulder, showing support during her helpless laughter.
Gently invites and takes Tani out of the room to show her something, responding to the child's clinginess with attention.
Calmly takes Tani out of the room to show her something, handling the child's clinginess with a gentle initiative.
Does not intervene or correct Vikram wiping his hands on Purnima's chador despite it being inappropriate.
Wakes up from sleep and promptly checks the corridor to join the New Year celebration, responding appropriately to the situation.
Is found asleep beside Tani, suggesting possible disengagement at a social moment.
Interacts calmly and appropriately with Aunty when greeted unexpectedly.
Does not initiate any notable action during the New Year gathering besides presence and receiving greetings, showing passivity.
Walks with Mimi, allowing her to lean on him, holds her shoes while supporting her, shows physical closeness and care.
Sits Mimi down gently on a chair instead of the bed, allowing her to take the lead in their intimate moment, responds sincerely and nervously to her kiss.
Cuddles puppy warmly after getting into bed, showing tenderness and affection for a vulnerable creature.
Rapidly solving the Rubik’s cube with clicking sounds despite having a prominent black eye.
Changing out of the same green sweater he has been wearing every day, indicating possibly poor personal care or attention to appearance.
Laughs with Tani and engages in lighthearted conversation about riding the motorcycle.
Shows care by asking about Fluffy and instructing Tani to find him so Bonnie di won't get angry.
Agrees to wait for Tani before riding the motorcycle, showing consideration and trustworthiness.
Pretends not to hear Tani calling initially and leaves hurriedly when she goes to look for Fluffy.
Approaches Mimi awkwardly with a shy smile, indicating some friendliness and sincerity.
Walks purposefully across the backyard towards the motorcycle and starts moving it towards the front lawns, showing intent and some physical capability.
Pretends not to hear Tani calling him, possibly showing evasiveness or lack of communication skills.
Admits to knowing how to ride a motorcycle and laughs confidently, indicating self-awareness and a measure of skill.
Acknowledges his limited skill compared to Tani's baba and states he's only practicing, showing realistic self-assessment but also hesitation.
Asks Tani where Fluffy (presumably a pet) has gone and directs her to check inside, evidencing responsibility and awareness.
Agrees to wait for Tani but then quickly leaves hurriedly in the opposite direction, breaking his promise and showing poor reliability.
Walks awkwardly with the motorcycle towards Mimi, appearing shy and out of breath, demonstrating effort despite physical limitations or discomfort.
Invites Mimi for a ride, initiating friendly interaction.
Leaves puppy under bed and then rides away with Mimi without acknowledging Tani's concern or the puppy.
Invites Mimi to go for a ride and allows her to ride the motorcycle, showing some confidence in social interaction but little clear evidence of skill or planning.
Keeps the motorcycle in a disorganized state; room and belongings messy and unorganized, reflecting a lack of personal order or discipline.
Does not intervene or stop Mimi from going into the cemetery and follows awkwardly, showing hesitation and lack of control of the situation.
Awkwardly holds the seat for support while Mimi rides the bike, indicating a lack of confidence or skill on the motorcycle.
Looks apprehensively for Mimi after spitting out the cake and tries to find her when she disappears.
Jumps out of his skin and is startled by Mimi's sudden prank behind the tree.
Pins Mimi aggressively and initiates a kiss in response to being startled.
Lies blissfully on the grass, showing relaxed comfort with Mimi nearby.
Rides motorcycle with Mimi sitting behind him, sharing a light moment despite his struggle.
Blissfully lying on the grass, half asleep, showing relaxed but passive behavior.
Rides a motorcycle but wobbles a little, struggles with control, causing Mimi to laugh.
Returns on motorcycle with Mimi but without Tani; looks around and responds to questions in a small, scared voice
Rides motorcycle with Mimi without informing others; returns dishevelled and evasive when questioned about Tani's whereabouts.
Looks around and takes in the attention of others calmly instead of panicking immediately.
Does not take the girl without asking Bonnie first, showing consideration for others' wishes.
Struggles with the bike stand, a neutral action with no social warmth implication.
Leaves Bonnie alone to look for someone else without informing anyone.
Shutu goes to check the bathroom and notices the frog, indicating alertness and observation.
Shutu leaves Bonnie alone while she goes looking for him, which indirectly contributes to the girl's disappearance.
Does not inform others before leaving or moving, causing confusion and lack of oversight.
Finds Tani’s discarded belt, calls out her name repeatedly in concern and excitement.
Trips and falls into an animal trap while searching for Tani, shouts for help.
Calls out to Maniya for help after falling into the pit, allowing Maniya to find him.
Passively waits for help while injured and muddy, showing vulnerability.
Calls out for help and communicates clearly to Maniya when stuck in the pit.
Ends up trapped in a pit, requiring rescue by Maniya.
Approaches Tani with concern and reaches out to her despite her scornful rejection.
Leaves after being rejected and shows signs of emotional devastation.
Watches Maniya silently from the corridor, appears tired and physically beaten.
Looks up slowly at Aunty when she suggests buying a ticket and making a phone call; shows vulnerability about not having money.
Notices Mimi awkwardly looking away while making coffee, but remains silent; watches her silently leave the kitchen.
Passes Mimi awkwardly, attempts a polite goodbye and mentions seeing her again in Calcutta.
Seems hesitant and quietly collects himself after Mimi advises him to concentrate on his studies.
Uninterested and distracted while helping Uncle and not fully engaged in the activity.
Pleadingly asks to hold the rifle just once, showing trust and desire to connect with Uncle.
Points rifle at Uncle and others in panic, putting others at risk.
Backs away unsteadily and reacts to Nandu’s voice, showing vulnerability and lack of malicious intent.
Leans out of the window to get a better look at McCluskiegunj signboard, showing curiosity and situational awareness.
Focuses on Rubik’s cube instead of engaging with others or helping when girls are huddled in the cold in the back seat, indicating disengagement and possible lack of social attentiveness.
Smiles back at Nandu after being told 'All out' but does not take visible initiative to assist the group.
Bends down to touch Aunty's feet and politely answers her questions about exams and his mother.
Helps with luggage when Manjari, the cook, comes to assist.
Looks surprised upon hearing about a man sleeping in the car, showing sensitivity and concern.
Initially does not lock the door when asked, showing a moment of forgetfulness or negligence in safety.
Politely bends down to touch Aunty's feet and answers questions courteously.
Picks up his backpack and helps move luggage, showing willingness to assist.
Forgets to lock the door initially despite warnings, showing lack of attention to security.
Looks surprised when Mimi mentions the man found sleeping in the car, indicating possible inattentiveness or lack of awareness.
Selects and wears an old, hand-knit sweater and hugs himself, showing a tender, nostalgic moment.
Rummages through his backpack and room carefully, selects a familiar sweater after smelling it, and changes into it.
Appears hesitant and emotionally affected, hugging himself and leaning into the cupboard quietly.
Walks and plays with Tani, tries to reach tree branch, shares the moment with her.
Responds to Tani's question about family tree, is straightforward and admits his name isn't there.
Tries to reach a tree branch by jumping but fails.
Ties a knot around the tyre while preparing a makeshift game.
Acknowledges his name is not on the family tree when asked.
Takes off slipper and carefully tries to chase frog away despite chaos.
Meekly steps outside when told to leave by Manjari.
Sits silently alone, doodling on failed mark sheet and obscuring his name.
Shows genuine interest and patience when Tani shares her boredom and explores his drawings with her.
Keeps to himself folding away his failed mark sheet and does not openly express frustration or anger.
Sits with others, listens intently to Vikram’s story with wide-eyed concentration.
Questions the reason spirits would come back, showing curiosity but not dismissiveness.
Looks spooked and alarmed during the spirit communication session, showing apparent fear and lack of control.
Points out the knocking sound, trying to attribute it to somebody, showing some engagement with the situation.
Sits up sweating and panting, indicating distress but shows awareness of his situation.
Is found dead with a rifle barrel pointed at his face, suggesting vulnerability or failure to protect himself.
Smiles and shakes his head when Bonnie asks him something, seeming disengaged and inattentive to Tani's request nearby.
Is absorbed with the puppies while others are interacting, missing social cues and failing to respond effectively to Tani's call.
Hands Bonnie the shawl and agrees to help with the child’s potty needs, smiles looking at Tani.
Responds to Mimi's question about his studies with a polite smile and shares his future plans without boasting.
Summons up his last shred of confidence and attempts to reverse the car.
Loses control of the car causing a crash and breaks the tail light.
Accepts responsibility for the puppy when Bonnie hands it over, calmly stroking it and concentrating on the chess board.
Maintains focus on chess despite interruptions and distractions around him.
Smiles at Mimi after playfully claiming he was winning in chess.
Looks at Mimi with an unsure smile after her teasing comment.
Winks at Tani confidently when left unchosen, then aligns with Brian and participates actively.
Starts playing really well after initial selection by Brian, showing skill in the game.
Plays really well and is cheered on by others, showing skill in the game.
Provokes Vikram with his tactics, showing some confidence and strategic thinking.
Hits Vikram’s face during a scuffle, escalating the conflict and leading to a fight.
Winces in pain as the Dettol stings him, remains mostly silent when questioned about his injury.
Appears scared and disoriented, gets physically stuck in a narrow space in the bathroom.
Rides a cycle through the early morning roads with Tani sitting in front of him.
Tries to make a phone call at the post office by showing the number to the postman and waiting patiently.
Keeps the phone receiver down after two rings without successfully connecting the call.
Acknowledges the failure of the phone call and correctly assumes the phone is not working.
Uses a magnifying glass skillfully to focus light on a piece of paper and chases an ant with it.
Laughs awkwardly and tries to downplay a conflict when asked about an injury.
Laughs awkwardly and dismisses the seriousness of a fight with a vague 'Oh yeh? Kuch nahi, kuch nahi.'
Explains the cultural practice of wearing payals politely to Tani when she asks, showing patience and helpfulness.
Mentions the injury happened while playing but downplays it, showing no signs of distress or seeking sympathy.
Locks the door and stays alert to sudden movement, showing caution and awareness.
Offers to get Mimi a drink and attentively prepares it, demonstrating helpfulness and attentiveness.
Accidentally hurts Mimi while trying to help with her twisted ankle, indicating awkwardness or lack of physical care.
Attempts to massage Mimi’s ankle and rotate it, showing initiative though lacking finesse.
Compliments Mimi to lighten the mood after the mishap, showing social grace and confidence.
Moves to help Mimi get up and supports her while walking unsteadily down the corridor, showing attentiveness and reliable behavior.
Tries to resist eating cake when Mimi forces it into his mouth but eventually eats a bit.
Looks around apprehensively calling out for Mimi when she disappears.
Pins Mimi against the tree and aggressively starts to kiss her after she playfully jumps on him.
Follows Nandu willingly to help search for Tani at night.
Obeys Nandu's instruction promptly and gets into the car without hesitation.
Follows Nandu during the search, demonstrating willingness to cooperate and act responsibly in a difficult situation.
Follows a dirt track in the wilderness at night searching for Tani, notices Tani's discarded belt and picks it up quickly.
Trips over a rock and falls into an underground animal trap while exploring the forest.
Sits quietly on the grounds holding Tani’s belt and a torch, alert but cautious when a wild cat appears, then calmly lets out a breath after it leaves.
Calls out for help from inside the trap, attempting to be heard.
Fails to make himself heard despite shouting; unable to escape or attract attention effectively.
Listens silently to his mother weeping on the phone, appearing emotionally distant.
Carefully packs his belongings and keeps a magnifying glass, indicating sentimental value.
Obtains train ticket and honestly hands change to Aunty, showing trustworthiness and sincerity.
Backpack emptied with clothes, books, toiletries strewn on bed, open journal with letter addressed to mother left visible.
